metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3861 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
LibUtils in Android 4.x before 4.4.4, 5.0.x before 5.0.2, 5.1.x before 5.1.1, 6.x before 2016-09-01, and 7.0 before 2016-09-01 mishandles conversions between Unicode character encodings with different encoding widths, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) via a crafted file, aka internal bug 29250543.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

adb - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-libadb - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-libbacktrace - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-libbase - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-libcrypto-utils - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-libcutils - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-liblog - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-libnativebridge - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-libnativeloader - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-libsparse - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-libutils - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-libziparchive - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-platform-system-core-headers - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-sdk-libsparse-utils - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-tools-adb - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-tools-fastboot - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
android-tools-mkbootimg - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
append2simg - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
fastboot - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
img2simg - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
mkbootimg - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
simg2img - 1:7.0.0+r1-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: android-platform-system-core package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:7.0.0+r1-4').
